newsitem.title: FRANCE: MAS ups ex-Paris cargo rates 5pct March 1.
newsitem.headline: MAS ups ex-Paris cargo rates 5pct March 1.

text.p: Malaysian Air System Bhd said it will increase its ex-Paris cargo rates by five percent, effective March 1.
The last time MAS increased ex-Paris rates was October 1995.

"The dcision to increase rates has more to do with what other carriers operating in the sector are doing and a management directive to improve yields rather than a real upturn in the market. However, we are hoping the spring will herald a sustainable recovery," a MAS cargo official told Reuters.
The official said: "The increases concern ex-France freight to Kuala Lumpur and all onward destinations with the exception of China."
MAS currently operates three Boeing 747-400 combi fights per week on the Paris-Kuala Lumpur route.
Two of the frequencies make a stopover in Munich and the Paris cargo station has an allocation of 25 tonnes on each flight.
The third frequency, added in June 1996, is non-stop and provides around 40-tonnes of ex-Paris capacity to Kuala Lumpur.
However, the airline has decided to replace the combis with 747 passenger aircraft, effective March 8 1997 while maintaining the same number of frequencies.

"Clearly, this move will cut our ex-Paris cargo capacity on the route considerably and we are currently in discussions to obtain a bigger allocation on MAS' Boeing 747F service between Amsterdam and Kuala Lumpur," he said.
"We are also in negotiations with another carrier about a possible block space agreement," the official added. -- Reuter Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44-171-542-7706 Fax+5017
